page.title: 12St.CUTHBERT'S CHURCH BLAYDON
page.content: The church was built in 1845 for the Church of England. It was designed by George Pickeing, and is made of local sandstone. There are four services a week, and funerals, marriages etc.The church seats approximately 350 people. The church has been extended but never modernised. It has been vadalized lots of times, and the roof was bombed in the Second World War. The church has a clock, and each dial is 5ft 6ins in diameter.There are six bells all made from bell metal, and the clangers are made of iron. The clock is electric. The pews are made of pine, and the lectern is solid brass.There are 25 steps upto the tower. The choirboys' cassocks are made of linen and are blue. The church is always full for midnight mass at Christmas.Rev. Blackburn has been vicar for the last eleven years.
